alert.note: Alert for Baker; Calhoun; Clay; Dougherty; Early; Miller; Mitchell; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 12:43PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Dale, southern Henry and northeastern Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, Miller, Dougherty, southeastern Clay, southeastern Randolph, western Mitchell, Baker, Calhoun, Early and south central Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 130 PM EST/1230 PM CST/... At 1242 PM EST/1142 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Edison to Blakely to near Kinsey. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Newton, Morgan, Headland, Albany, Blakely, Camilla, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Edison, Arlington, Webb, Columbia, Leary, Walker, Douglasville, Centerville, Newville and Gordon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Calhoun; Clay; Dougherty; Early; Miller; Mitchell; Randolph; Terrell
